message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about generating long-form texts using neural language models. The focus is on improving coherence and cohesion, which are important aspects of natural language generation. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and generation. The paper also proposes a new neural language model, which involves training using policy gradient, a technique commonly used in reinforcement learning. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses neural discriminators to provide feedback signals, which is a technique commonly used in adversarial training. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves training neural networks, which suggests that it may belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision), as it involves generating long-form texts, which may be used in image captioning or other computer vision tasks.
